posts.cooked:
Allow excluding chats from the “All chats” chat folder if those chats are part of another chat folder. For me this would be the improvement to actually start using chat folders. Right now, if I add a chat to a “family” chat folder, I see that chat in two different chat folders and I find that confusing/unhelpful.

My use case would be to organise chats into chat folders so that I am alerted to a new chat in a specific folder without being immediately distracted by the chat content (by using the “All chats” as the main view). Essentially using chat folders to “hide” chats from the main view

If a chat doesn’t exist in any other chat folder, then it would make sense to be automatically added to the “All chats” chat folder.

posts.name: Bentley
posts.cooked:
The way the chat folders are currently set up, I don’t even see why the feature was added.

If you create a folder with a few chats in it and then you want to archive a chat in the ‘All Chats’ that is also in the second folder it also deletes it from the second folder. Makes no sense.

What is the point of having folders if this is the way they work. I hate to say it, but they should be set up like the folders in Telegram.

IMO there is no added benefit to having folders. I deleted my folders since they don’t work the way I expected them to. Hopefully they will improve the feature in the near future.

Wish they would add a way to mute reaction notifications. That would be a handy feature in large groups.

Bentley:

If you create a folder with a few chats in it and then you want to archive a chat in the ‘All Chats’ that is also in the second folder it also deletes it from the second folder.

It’s exactly how I thought it would work. What behaviour did you expect?

Wopfi:

It’s exactly how I thought it would work. What behaviour did you expect?

In what world does deleting a file in folder A automatically lead to a deletion in folder B of the same file?

Perhaps this is a case of chat “folder” being a massive misnomer.

The current functionality is unusable (for me) and I immediately turned it off because of this.

So you expect the chat to stay the way it was when the folder was created? When the chat in the first folder is archived, the chat stays in the second folder? When the chat in the first folder receives a message, the chat in the second folder doesn’t? When you delete a message in the first folder, it still exists in the second folder? What would be the use case for such a behaviour? I don’t think that would be very practical.

But yes, the name “Folder” may be a bit misleading and it would be better to call them “Filters”.

And yes, the option you were requesting in your first post would be neat.

Wopfi:

What would be the use case for such a behaviour?

You are right. This wouldn’t be useful either but would align with my definition of folder behaviours. What is the use of the current feature? Chat filters would be a way better name, even though I still don’t get the use case.

posts.name: Bentley
posts.cooked:
I expect that items in the folders will remain in the folder even if i archive chats in the ‘All Chat’ folder. They same way they work in telegram. I don’t see any practical way to use them as they are. Can’t even call them filters the way they work now.

I have been using Signal longer than I’ve been using telegram, but telegram has had folders for a while now, and i got used to the way they worked there. Makes sense to me, and helps me organize my groups and chats.

The only way I can see using the folders feature would be if it was possible to “hide” the all chats folder, and then have everything else in other folders. No need to clean-up (archive) chats in the All Chats folder as that folder would be hidden.

IMG_20241118_1117331080×337 38.8 KB

I just got a single message, and at first glance it looks like I have three, one in each “folder”. Doesn’t look very useful for decluttering, which is one of the purposes of grouping things.

On another note, Archived could be just another folder, instead of its own thing.

frombeyondspace:

Chat filters would be a way better name, even though I still don’t get the use case.

For me, at least, it does exactly what I wanted from chat folders. It allows me to filter my chats, so when I’m looking for people in my family or my closest friends, I can quickly access their chats by selecting the associated folder.

Also, I quickly see if I have unread messages from my family or my close friends without scrolling.

I agree that it isn’t a “must have” for me, but it’s a nice convenience feature and by the look of it, there were feature requests for this.

Maybe you have significanty more Signal chats than me so that your main view at any point in time can have a lot of new messages?

Perhaps a personality defect, but I do not like unread messages in my main view but sometimes I do not want to read a message from a particular person at the time they sent it. So I guess I’d be really happy to get the requested change because I have certain people who I do not want to block, but I also do not want to be distracted by their new messages hanging around in my main view. I could archive these but then I don’t want to forget them completely either. So selecting particular people in a group chat, means I have a visible reminder of a new message from a select group of people, without being immediately distracted by the message content (if I could remove these people from “All chats”)

I agree that it would be nice if we could configure a list of excluded chats for “All Chats”. Best option in my opinion would be to make the settings of “All Chats” editable and to allow the selection of Chat Folders themselves in the exclude List.
My personal wish would be a toggle that turns “all chats” into “remaining chats”. (that is "toggle on/off whether chats in a folder are also shown in “all chats”)

posts.name: Maksym Kozub
posts.cooked:
Bentley:

The only way I can see using the folders feature would be if it was possible to “hide” the all chats folder, and then have everything else in other folders. No need to clean-up (archive) chats in the All Chats folder as that folder would be hidden.

I support the feature request we are commenting on here, and the ability to hide the “All chats” folder is not the same as the ability to hide a chat from it.
I have hundreds of chats, and I have added dozens of them to folders, like “Relatives”, “Comrades-in-arms”, “Doctors”, etc. I still have dozens of other chats, which I read, and I reply to new messages in them, but those chats have nothing in common to create any folder for them. It does not make sense to pin all such chats, either. (It would also be quite cumbersome.) In this situation, whenever I have to read a new message in one of those “unfoldered” chats, I still have to scroll a lot through All chats. You already mentioned Telegram; while it definitely belongs to a completely different class of messengers, I agree that this particular feature is quite nice there. Namely, after you add a chat to a folder in Telegram and archive that chat, the chat disappears from the list of all chats but remains visible in the respective folder. I.e., I add a chat with one of my doctors to “Doctors” folder, then archive it, and I only see that chat under Doctors, without seeing it in the general list of [“Neither doctors nor relatives nor anything other in common” :)] chats. (I still want to see and follow those other chats, therefore I do not want to hide All chats.)

I created an account here to request the same thing.

If they don’t want to implement it that way, maybe we could have a folder option that makes every chat added to that folder be hidden from “all chats”.

Hey, also created an acc for this. For me, signal was never useable for organizations, like other chat platorms (matrix, mattermost, discord…) because of the lack of encapsulation of the organisations. I don’t want to have my personal messages mixed with the chats of the organization(s), because that is messy.

For this usecase the missing feature is to exclude chats from All Chats option, because then i can containerize the organization chats.

posts.name: yar
posts.cooked:
Strongly agreed.

The “all chats” folder is not useful. Much more useful would be a folder called “other chats” or “unfoldered chats” or “chats not in any other folder”

posts.name: makiro
posts.cooked:
I just create a folder that I set as the first folder that has all chats except the ones I don’t want.

I pretty much never end up using the “all chats” folder that is relegated to the very end of my folder list.

I agree that this is really necessary to make the folders functional for more use cases. I only recently started using the folders feature when it was added to the desktop beta and I was hoping that it would solve the issue of Signal not having a communities feature (I discussed that use case a little here: Option to *group* chats / create chat folders - #125 by Freefall5989 ) but without the ability to either exclude chats from the ‘all chats’ / ’all other chats’ folder or that added functionality doesn’t really work to help organize the inbox better.

The other exclusion feature I’m hoping for is the ability to exclude chats as a group (being in a specific folder for example, more than the current options of ‘group chats’ or ‘1:1 chats’) instead of selecting them individually.

link_counts.title: Option to *group* chats / create chat folders

posts.cooked:
As soon as one start using the chat folders feature and create even one single folder, I find “All Chats” folder becoming redundant. I created a folder for ‘Family’ and ‘Groups’. What I expect is all the chats that doesn’t fit in these two groups only to show up in a folder perhaps named as ‘Other chats’ or “All other chats”, than everything showing up (that too as the first tab in the UI) as “All chats”

At least if there is an option to move the “All Chats” to be the last one in the UI, It would have made a bit more sense.

gogol:

At least if there is an option to move the “All Chats” to be the last one in the UI, It would have made a bit more sense.

This option does exist on android (folders can be ordered freely), does it not exist for you?

links.title: Option to *group* chats / create chat folders
